Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Acidic phospholipase A2 PnPLA2 (svPLA2; Reptiles, animals)
Sequence Information.Family: Belongs to the phospholipase A2 family (Group II subfamily)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.22251437]Gram-positive bacteria:S. aureus ATCC 25923 and S. aureus ATCC 29213.
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22251437]MHD=7.5 μg against agarose erythrocyte-egg yolk gels
Sequence Information.Function: Snake venom phospholipase A2 (PLA2) that has antibacterial activity against S.aureus ATCC 25923 and ATCC 29213, acts by inducing bacterial membrane breakage. Displays a potent inhibitory effect on collagen-induced human platelet aggregation and has indirect hemolytic activity. Does not show cytotoxicity to murine skeletal muscle myoblasts. PLA2 catalyzes the calcium-dependent hydrolysis of the 2-acyl groups in 3-sn-phosphoglycerides.

Literature.Title: An acidic phospholipase A(2) with antibacterial activity from Porthidium nasutum snake venom.
Literature.Reference: Comp Biochem Physiol B Biochem Mol Biol. 2012 Apr;161(4)341-347.
Literature.Author: Vargas LJ, Londoño M, Quintana JC, Rua C, Segura C, Lomonte B, Núñez V.
